ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Bewitching madness!
ygData.msgSnippet: Interesting to read all the comments.  I have to admit to never seeing this before, even when I used charm all night one time in Solusek.  I just imagined it
ygData.messageBody:
Interesting to read all the comments. I have to admit to never seeing
this before, even when I used charm all night one time in Solusek. I
just imagined it was another little unusual thing with Dreadlands/
Kunark, along with the random faction changes and the way mobs seem to
ignore the puller and everyone else and focus on one party member for
no obvious reason.

However, I'll try out a number of commands and be more wary in future.
Even if we can just take 1 mob out of the fight it's a help, never
mind if it isn't attacking and killing the others alongside us! :-)

Thanks again all!


On Tue, 16 May 2000 09:26:11 -0400, you wrote:

>it happens. All you have to do is give it a /pet back off and have it
>attack the correct target.
>
>It's because, in that short time between charm breaking and you re-charming
>it the hate list has been modified by what your party is doing. When you
>re-charm it stops attacking you and goes to the next thing on it's hate
>list. Thus it will sometimes (though not always) jump all over one of your
>party members even though you charmed it. Just target the correct critter,
>give /pet back off and /pet kill
>
>That'll take care of it ;)
>
>Lyrnia Jongleur
>Bard of Norrath
